bibl.title: Letter to Florence M. Read, February 25, 1922

div1.p: The writer recommends Connor for yellow fever work in Africa.

div1.head: Letter to Florence M. Read, February 25, 1922
div1.opener:
/LC
I. H. B.
Africa
, D. C.
February 25, 1922.
Miss Florence M. Read,
Assistant Secretary,
International Health Board,
61 Broadway, New York, N. Y.
Dear Miss Read:
div1.p:
Dr. Rose asked me to suggest the name of some American who
would do as a Clinician to go with the Yellow Fever Commission to
Africa. In addition to that of Parker of Guayaquil--who I did not
think would go--let me add that of Roland Connor, at present the
Chief of Medical Clinic at Ancon Hospital, who. I understand, will
probably wish to leave Ancon during this year.

Dr. Connor has been at Ancon since 1907 or '08 and has held
his present position since 1914. He has not had much experience with
yellow fever. although he has seen a few cases of it, but his ser-
vice has been such that he should be very familiar with the tropical
diseases with which it is liable to be confounded.

He is about 38 or 40 years old: strong physically. I do not
know whether he is married or not.
